MARKETING CLOUD GROWTH
Create a Landing Page in Marketing Cloud Growth

A landing page can provide introductory information, inform people about your brand, or host a form to gather prospect details. To include a form on your landing page, create the form first, and then create its landing page. A draft landing page is available as part of a Sign-Up Form campaign.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create or edit content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

any CMS workspace contributor role


To publish or unpublish content:	

Marketing Cloud Manager permission set

AND

a CMS workspace contributor role of content admin or content manager

Not sure where to start? Check out these basics for creating content in Marketing Cloud.

From your marketing workspace, create or open a landing page.
To build the structure and basic components to create the body of your landing page, add layout components.
Drag the Image component to the page, and insert a header image.
Drag the Heading component to the page, and enter a headline.
To improve a landing page’s visibility in search engine results, click SEO and then select Let search engines index this page.
Save your work, and then preview your landing page.
Test the page and review its consent banner.
Publish the landing page.
Open the landing page record and click URL. Find the Public URL field and click the link.
Publish the landing page.

Publishing a landing page activates any URL aliases that aren’t already active. When you publish a landing page that contains a form, the form is published, and the flow associated with the form is activated.

If you want to chain marketing content together, add a Button component that points to another piece of marketing content. To promote the page, include the link in emails or web and social content.

Working with Landing Pages in Marketing Cloud Growth
To ensure that your customers get the best experience from your content, preview your landing page. To edit a published landing page, unpublish it and then edit URL details, search engine optimization (SEO) settings, and more.
URL Details for Marketing Cloud Growth Landing Pages
Each landing page has its own URL that accepts or redirects traffic to the page. You can edit and manage URL details such as the public URL, URL alias, and the URL redirect from the content detail page on the URL tab.
SEO Page Properties for Landing Pages in Marketing Cloud Growth
To improve search engine optimization (SEO), use head tags to add structured data to your landing page. Including structured data provides more control over how your landing page and its information looks in search results.

title: Create and Publish a Landing Page in Marketing Cloud Growth
